detachmentRule.name: get stuck in
detachmentRule.lore: Once an Ork gets stuck into hand-to-hand combat, they quickly overwhelm their enemies through sheer ferocity
detachmentRule.description: Melee weapons equipped by ORKS models from your army have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability.

enhacements.name: Follow Me Ladz
enhacements.lore: Always found at the forefront of an assault, this Ork likes to be the first into the fray.
enhacements.description: ORKS model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, add 2'' to the Move characteristic of models in that unit.

enhacements.name: Headwoppa’s Killchoppa
enhacements.lore: Grand Warboss Headwoppa and his tribe were last seen charging headlong into a horde of Khornate daemons, but legend speaks of a blood-slick choppa that still turns up occasionally. Though this weapon looks normal, a dark voice is said to growl in the mind of its wielder, driving them on to ever greater excesses of violence.
enhacements.description: ORKS model only. Melee weapons equipped by the bearer that do not have the [EXTRA ATTACKS] ability have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] ability.

enhacements.name: Kunnin’ but Brutal
enhacements.lore: Feigning weakness, this greenskin allows his foes to close in before delivering a brutal flurry of attacks.
enhacements.description: ORKS model only. While the bearer is leading a unit, that unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

enhacements.name: Supa-cybork Body
enhacements.lore: The original owner of this one-of-a-kind endoskeleton became the envy of every Warboss around, and was soon gutted and stripped for parts by a stronger rival. The Supa-Cybork Body has been retransplanted several times since then, filling its new owner with confidence, resilience and a belated hope that the Painboyz gave it a quick clean before shoving it back in place…
enhacements.description: ORKS model only. The bearer has the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.

stratagems.name: careen!
stratagems.lore: Broodkin are so fanatically loyal that they do not hesitate to sacrifice themselves to protect their leaders.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS CHARACTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a CHARACTER model in your unit would lose a wound, select one friendly GENESTEALER CULTS unit within 3'' of it (excluding VEHICLE units). Your CHARACTER model does not lose that wound and that selected unit suffers one mortal wound instead.

stratagems.name: orks is never beaten
stratagems.lore: Broodkin are so fanatically loyal that they do not hesitate to sacrifice themselves to protect their leaders.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS CHARACTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a CHARACTER model in your unit would lose a wound, select one friendly GENESTEALER CULTS unit within 3'' of it (excluding VEHICLE units). Your CHARACTER model does not lose that wound and that selected unit suffers one mortal wound instead.

stratagems.name: unbridled carnage
stratagems.lore: Squirming, crawling and scrabbling through confined spaces is second nature to many broodkin, and is a skill they use to assail seemingly impregnable enemy positions.
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS unit from your army that is arriving using the Deep Strike ability this phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can be set up anywhere on the battlefield that is more than 3'' horizontally away from all enemy models.
stratagems.restrictions: A unit targeted by this Stratagem is not eligible to declare a charge in the same turn.

stratagems.name: 'ard as nails'
stratagems.lore: These Cultists have tracked their enemies tirelessly, as predatory beasts stalk their prey. Only when their position is perfect do they strike, engulfing their victims in a hail of unexpected firepower.
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS unit from your army that arrived from Reserves this turn and has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, improve the Ballistic Skill and Armour Penetration characteristics of ranged weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1.

stratagems.name: mob rule
stratagems.lore: In dark nooks and crevices the true believers of the cult whisper and skulk, all but invisible to those who approach.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One GENESTEALER CULTS INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of that enemy unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit has the Stealth ability and can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 12''

stratagems.name: ere we go
stratagems.lore: Ever cunning and duplicitous, broods of the faithful often vanish back into tunnels and vents after their initial strike, ready to regroup and attack again elsewhere.
stratagems.target: Up to two GENESTEALER CULTS BATTLELINE units from your army, or one other GENESTEALER CULTS INFANTRY unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Remove the targeted units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.restrictions: The targeted units must have the Deep Strike ability and cannot be within Engagement Range of any enemy units when targeted.
